newsitem.title: USA: KCBT wheat seen opening one to two cents lower.
newsitem.headline: KCBT wheat seen opening one to two cents lower.

text.p: KCBT hard red winter wheat futures were seen opening one to two cents a bushel lower with conditions appearing almost ideal for harvesting in south-west and south-central Kansas, dealers said.
"It looks like clear sailing for the harvest," one dealer said noting meteorologists appeared to have backed away from previous forecasts for rains on Wednesday.
There was talk that up to half the state's wheat crop could be cut by the end of the week and yields continue to be higher than most had anticipated.
